title: Orion Model Hosting using ASML Framework
narration: This presentation provides an overview of how the Orion model is hosted using the Alexa Shopping Machine Learning or ASML framework. We will explore the key components architecture and deployment process involved in making this model available for realtime inferences within the ADC system.

title: Introduction to ML Models
content:
Computational algorithms learning from data.
Making predictions without explicit programming.
Trained on historical data for future predictions.
image_desc: Machine learning model diagram. Type: illustration
narration: Machine learning models are powerful tools that learn patterns from data. Unlike traditional programming these models can make predictions or decisions without explicit instructions for every scenario. They are trained using historical data allowing them to generalize and make accurate predictions on new unseen data.

title: Key Components of ML Models
content:
Input Features: Variables used for predictions.
Parameters: Values learned during training.
Output: Prediction or decision made by the model.
narration: Every machine learning model has three essential components. Input features are the variables or attributes used to make predictions. Parameters are the values learned during the training phase defining how inputs are transformed into outputs. Finally the output is the prediction or decision made by the model based on these inputs and parameters.

title: Classification Models
content:
Supervised learning algorithm.
Categorising input data into predefined classes.
Examples: Yes/No, multiple-choice options.
narration: Classification models are a type of supervised learning algorithm. They are designed to categorize input data into predefined classes or categories. These models can handle simple binary classifications like Yes or No or more complex scenarios involving multiplechoice options.

title: How Classification Models Work
content:
**Training Phase**
Learns from labeled examples.
Identifies patterns and relationships.
Adjusts parameters to minimize errors.
**Inference Phase**
New data is fed into the model.
Applies learned patterns for prediction.
Outputs a class label or probability distribution.
image_desc: Training and Inference phases. Type: diagram
narration: Classification models operate in two distinct phases. During the training phase the model learns from labeled examples identifying patterns and relationships between features and class labels. It adjusts its parameters to minimize classification errors. In the inference phase new unseen data is fed into the trained model which applies the learned patterns to predict the class label or probability distribution.

title: SageMaker Model and Endpoint
content: A SageMaker Model is a container image encapsulating the ML model and code. A SageMaker Endpoint is a deployed instance for real-time predictions.
image_desc: SageMaker Model and Endpoint architecture. Type: diagram
narration: In the context of Amazon SageMaker a SageMaker Model is a container image that encapsulates a machine learning model along with the code needed to run it. A SageMaker Endpoint is a deployed instance of a SageMaker Model which can be used to perform realtime predictions or inferences.

title: ASML Framework Overview
content:
ASML: Alexa Shopping Machine Learning framework.
Built on SageMaker and CDK.
Rapidly productionising ML models.
Auto-scaling for real-time inference.
narration: The Alexa Shopping Machine Learning or ASML framework is a library built on top of SageMaker and the Cloud Development Kit or CDK. It enables the rapid productionization of machine learning models in a SageMaker HTTPS endpoint with autoscaling capabilities for realtime inference. ASML simplifies the process of deploying and managing machine learning models at scale.

title: ASML Model Architecture: Essential Packages
content:
**Schema Package**
Defines input and output data structure.
Validates requests and responses.
Ensures data consistency and type safety.
**Inference Service Package**
Contains model hosting code and logic.
Processes requests and transforms data.
Calls the model for inference.
narration: A successful model and endpoint deployment using the ASML framework requires three essential Amazon packages. The Schema Package defines the structure of input and output data ensuring data consistency and type safety through validation. The Inference Service Package is a Pythonbased package containing the model hosting code and business logic responsible for processing requests transforming data and calling the model for inference.

title: ASML Model Architecture: Docker File Package & CDK Integration
content:
**Docker File Package**
Defines container environment.
Specifies base image and dependencies.
Sets up environment for the model.
**CDK Integration**
Brazil Image generated using Inference and Docker Packages.
Creates SageMaker Model and Endpoint constructs.
Validates Input/Output against Schema.
image_desc: Docker and CDK integration. Type: diagram
narration: The Docker File Package defines the container environment for the model specifying the base image installing required dependencies and setting up the environment for the model. The CDK integration uses these packages to generate a Brazil Image create SageMaker Model and Endpoint constructs and ensures that the endpoint validates input and output against the schema defined in the Schema Package.

title: Additional Amazon Packages in ASML Pipeline
content:
PythonTests package: Integration tests.
RDE Package: Testing without cloud deployment.
narration: In addition to the core packages the ASML pipeline includes other important components. The PythonTests package hosts integration tests calling the SageMaker Endpoint with inputs and validating the responses against expected outputs. The RDE Package allows for testing these integration tests without needing to deploy changes into the cloud.

title: ASML and ADC: Model Deployment and Inference
content:
Scientists develop models, ADC hosts them.
Model Artifacts, Inference Code, and Dependencies.
Model Artifacts uploaded to Sthree Bucket before deployment.
image_desc: ADC and ASML workflow. Type: diagram
narration: Scientists develop the models and share them with ADC which uses the ASML framework to host the models for realtime inferences. This involves providing Model Artifacts Inference Code and a list of Dependency libraries. The Model Artifacts are uploaded to an Sthree Bucket before deploying the model.

title: Inference Flow with ASML
content:
Request validated against input schema.
Input data transformed for the model.
Model performs inference.
Output transformed to expected format.
Response validated against output schema.
Validated response returned to the client.
narration: When a request is made to the SageMaker Endpoint the ASML framework ensures a smooth and reliable inference flow. The request is first validated against the input schema. The input data is then transformed into the format expected by the model. The model performs inference to generate predictions. The output is transformed into the expected response format validated against the output schema and finally the validated response is returned to the client.
